meanings.definition: To cut down grass or grain with a scythe or machine.
meanings.sent1: Dad will mawn the tall grass in the backyard tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a machine to mawn the wheat field efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The noisy mawn of the lawnmower woke up the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the scythe mawning through the wheat was like music to the farmer's ears.
meanings.sent5: I watched in awe as the farmer expertly mawned the field with precision.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting down grass or grain.
meanings.sent1: After the mawn, the field looked neat and tidy.
meanings.sent2: The mawn of the grass was done early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The sudden mawn of the wheat startled the birds nearby.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic mawn of the scythe echoed across the valley.
meanings.sent5: The mawn of the hay signaled the start of harvest season.

meanings.definition: The crop of hay or grain that has been cut and dried.
meanings.sent1: The barn was filled with the fragrant mawn of the freshly cut hay.
meanings.sent2: The golden mawn of wheat shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The mawn of the barley was stored carefully in the silo.
meanings.sent4: The mawn of the oats was a bountiful harvest this year.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of the mawn filled the entire farm.
